description:

Directions:
You Will Need: 4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts or 8 skinless, boneless chicken thighs (about 1-1/2 lb); 1 medium onion sliced (about 1 cup (optional); 3 red and/or green peppers, cut into strips or 1 pkg (14 oz) frozen pepper strips; 1 can (8 oz) pineapple chunks, drained (optional).

Oven:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F. 1. Place chicken into a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Arrange peppers around chicken. Top with onion and pineapple, if desired. Spread sauce evenly over chicken, vegetables and pineapple. 2. Bake 40 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender. Let stand 5 minutes. 3. Stir sauce, vegetables and pineapple.

description:
Create your own sauce by adding minced fresh ginger root, garlic, green onions, brown sugar or herbs.

Directions

Chicken:
Marinate 3 lbs. of pieces in sauce, in sealed plastic bag, in refrigerator 4 hours, or overnight turning over occasionally. Bake at 350 degrees F 45 min., or until no longer pink in center, turning and basting once.

To BBQ:
Place marinated pieces on grill 5 inches from heat. cook about 20 min. on each side, baste occasionally. Beef (Lamb): Marinate tender steaks or chops in sauce about 30 min.; broil or grill to desired doneness. Or, marinate beef or lamb for kabobs about 30 min.; thread on skewers with desired vegetables and broil or grill to desired doneness.

Spareribs:
Bake 3 lbs. cut-up spareribs in shallow pan at 350 degrees F 45 min.; brush well with sauce. Bake 30 minutes longer, or until tender; basting occasionally with sauce. Shake well before using. Refrigerate after opening.

description:
Made right with hatch green chiles, garlic and lime. Stubb's Cookin' Sauce makes dinner tasty and simple by bringing the legendary flavors of Stubb's into your home.

Directions

Slow Cooker: What You Need: 1.5 lbs. of chicken breast and tortillas. 1. Rub chicken with spice pack. 2. Place in slow cooker and pour in cooking sauce. Cover on low for 6-8 hours or high for 4-5 hours. 3. After cooking, drain liquid from slow cooker and shred chicken with forks. 4. Pour Finishing Sauce over chicken and heat on low for 30 minutes. Serve with your favorite extras.

Skillet: What You Need: 1.5 lbs. of chicken breast, olive oil and tortillas. 1. Add 2 tbsp olive oil to skillet and heat on medium heat. 2. Dice chicken and add to skillet. Shake spice pack over chicken. 3. Pour cooking sauce over chicken and cover, stirring occasionally until chicken is done (Stubb's recommends following safe minimum cooking temperatures). 4. Uncover, pour in finishing sauce and simmer on low. Serve with your favorite extras. More Ways to Enjoy: Use pork or beef instead of chicken. Add In extras like onions, cheese, tomatoes, avocado or sour cream.

description:
Keep it tasty, simple and satisfying. Serve with steamed rice.

Recipe Guide:
Simply Add: 2 tbsp canola or vegetable oil; 1-1/2 lb thinly sliced boneless chicken/beef/turkey or whole peeled shrimp; 1 cup (about 1/2 lb) sliced vegetables (eg zucchini, peppers or pumpkin).

Directions:
Step 1: In a medium saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add red curry paste (Spice it How You Like: If you like it mild, use less curry paste, remove the dried chilies and add an extra 1/2 cup of water. If you like it hot, use all the curry paste and chop up the dried chilies before adding them) and cook, stirring, for about a minute until it starts to smell yummy. Step 2: Now's the time to pour in the creamy coconut milk and 1 cup water. Step 3: Stir through dried herbs and chilies (Spice it How You Like: If you like it mild, use less curry paste, remove the dried chilies and add an extra 1/2 cup of water. If you like it hot, use all the curry paste and chop up the dried chilies before adding them) and bring your curry back to the boil. Step 4: Drain and discard liquid from bamboo shoots. Add bamboo shoots, raw meat or seafood and vegetables. The whole lot will poach in your curry sauce to make it more flavorful! Simmer for 5-15 minutes or until your chosen additions are cooked through. Enjoy!
title: Marion's Kitchen Thai Red Curry 15.9-oz.

description:
Made right with tomatoes, chipotle and chili peppers. Stubb's Cookin' Sauce makes dinner tasty and simple by bringing the legendary flavors of Stubb's into your home.

Directions
Skillet: Choose How Spicy: use 1/4 spice pack for mild/medium; use 1/2 spice pack for medium/hot; use full spice pack for extra hot. What You Need: 1.5 lbs. of ground beef, beef broth and olive oil. 1. Put 1 tbsp. olive oil in pan then add ground beef. 2. Add spice pack to beef as desired - 1/4 pack for mild/medium chili, 1/2 pack for medium/hot and full pack for extra hot. 3. Cook ground beef in skillet until browned (Stubb's recommends following safe minimum cooking temperatures). Add cooking sauce and 1-1/2 cups of beef broth. 4. Let simmer for 15 minutes. Serve with your favorite extras. Slow Cooker: Choose How Spicy: use 1/4 spice pack for mild/medium; use 1/2 spice pack for medium/hot; use full spice pack for extra hot. What You Need: 1.5 lbs. ground beef and beef broth. 1. Place ground beef in slow cooker and pour in cooking sauce. 2. Add 1-1/2 cups beef broth. 3. Add spice pack to beef as desired - 1/4 pack for mild/medium chili, 1/2 pack for medium/hot and full pack for extra hot. 4. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 4-5 hours. Serve with your favorite extras. More Ways to Enjoy: Use ground turkey or beef tips instead of ground beef. Try beer or wine instead of beef broth. Add in extras like beans, onions, peppers, cheese, sour cream or hot sauce.
title: Stubb's® Cookin' Sauce™ Chili Fixins 12 oz
